 26 
 27 require.def('antie/widgets/label',
 28 	['antie/widgets/widget'],
 29 	function(Widget) {
 30 		/**
 31 		 * The Label widget displays text. It supports auto-truncation (with ellipsis) of text to fit.
 32 		 * @name antie.widgets.Label
 33 		 * @class
 34 		 * @extends antie.widgets.Widget
 35 		 * @param {String} [id] The unique ID of the widget. If excluded, a temporary internal ID will be used (but not included in any output).
 36 		 * @param {String} [text] The text content of this label.
 37 		 */
 38 		var Label = Widget.extend(/** @lends antie.widgets.Label.prototype */ {
 39 			/**
 40 			 * @constructor
 41 			 * @ignore
 42 			 */
 43 			init: function(id, text) {
 44                 // The current API states that if only one parameter is passed to
 45                 // use that value as the text and auto generate an internal id
 46 				if(arguments.length == 1) {
 47 					this._text = id;
 48 					this._super();
 49 				} else {
 50 					this._text = text;
 51 					this._super(id);
 52 				}
 53 				this._truncationMode = Label.TRUNCATION_MODE_NONE;
 54 				this._maxLines = 0;
 55 				this._width = 0;
 56 				this.addClass('label');
 57 			},
 58 			/**
 59 			 * Renders the widget and any child widgets to device-specific output.
 60 			 * @param {antie.devices.Device} device The device to render to.
 61 			 * @returns A device-specific object that represents the widget as displayed on the device (in a browser, a DOMElement);
 62 			 */
 63 			render: function(device) {
 64 				// TODO: is there a more efficient way of doing this?
 65 				var s;
 66 				if(this._width && this._maxLines && this._text && (this._truncationMode == Label.TRUNCATION_MODE_RIGHT_ELLIPSIS)) {
 67 					var h = device.getTextHeight("fW", this._width, this.getClasses());
 68 					var allowedHeight = h * this._maxLines;
 69 					var currentHeight = device.getTextHeight(this._text, this._width, this.getClasses());
 70 				
 71 					var len = this._text.length;
 72 					while(currentHeight > allowedHeight && len > 1) {
 73 						len = Math.floor((len * allowedHeight) / currentHeight);
 74 						currentHeight = device.getTextHeight(this._text.substring(0, len) + "...", this._width, this.getClasses());
 75 					}
 76 					while(currentHeight <= allowedHeight && len <= this._text.length) {
 77 						len++;
 78 						currentHeight = device.getTextHeight(this._text.substring(0, len) + "...", this._width, this.getClasses());
 79 					}
 80 					len--;
 81 				
 82 					if(len < this._text.length) {
 83 						// truncate at word boundary
 84 						var boundaryLen = len;
 85 						while(boundaryLen && !/\w\W$/.test(this._text.substring(0, boundaryLen+1))) {
 86 							boundaryLen--;
 87 						}
 88 						if(boundaryLen > 0) {
 89 							s = this._text.substring(0, boundaryLen) + "...";
 90 						} else {
 91 							s = this._text.substring(0, len) + "...";
 92 						}
 93 					} else {
 94 						s = this._text;
 95 					}
 96 				} else {
 97 					s = this._text;
 98 				}
 99 
100 				if(!this.outputElement) {
101 					this.outputElement = device.createLabel(this.id, this.getClasses(), s);
102 				} else {
103 					device.setElementContent(this.outputElement, s);
104 				}
105 
106 				return this.outputElement;
107 			},
108 			/**
109 			 * Sets the text displayed by this label.
110 			 * @param {String} text The new text to be displayed.
111 			 */
112 			setText: function(text) {
113 				this._text = text;
114 				if(this.outputElement) {
115 					this.render(this.getCurrentApplication().getDevice());
116 				}
117 			},
118 			/**
119 			 * Gets the current text displayed by this label.
120 			 * @returns The current text displayed by this label.
121 			 */
122 			getText: function() {
123 				return this._text;
124 			},
125 			/**
126 			 * Sets the truncation mode (currently {@link antie.widgets.Label.TRUNCATION_MODE_NONE} or {@link antie.widgets.Label.TRUNCATION_MODE_RIGHT_ELLIPSIS}).
127 			 * 
128 			 * @deprecated TRUNCATION_MODE_RIGHT_ELLIPSIS relies on browserdevice.getTextHeight(), which can be inaccurate.
129 			 * @param {String} mode The new truncation mode.
130 			 */
131 			setTruncationMode: function(mode) {
132 				this._truncationMode = mode;
133 			},
134 			/**
135 			 * Sets the maximum lines displayed when a truncation mode is set.
136 			 * @param {String} lines The maximum number of lines to display.
137 			 */
138 			setMaximumLines: function(lines) {
139 				this._maxLines = lines;
140 			},
141 			/**
142 			 * Sets the width of this label for use with truncation only.
143 			 * @param {Integer} width The width of this label in pixels
144 			 */
145 			setWidth: function(width) {
146 				this._width = width;
147 			}
148 		});
149 
150 		/**
151 		 * Do not truncate the text. Let the browser wrap to as many lines required to display all the text.
152 		 * @name TRUNCATION_MODE_NONE
153 		 * @memberOf antie.widgets.Label
154 		 * @constant
155 		 * @static
156 		 */
157 		Label.TRUNCATION_MODE_NONE = 0;
158 		/**
159 		 * Truncate text to fit into the number of lines specified by {@link antie.widgets.Label#setMaximumLines} by removing characters at the end of the string and append an ellipsis if text is truncated.
160 		 * @constant
161 		 * @name TRUNCATION_MODE_RIGHT_ELLIPSIS
162 		 * @memberOf antie.widgets.Label
163 		 * @static
164 		 */
165 		Label.TRUNCATION_MODE_RIGHT_ELLIPSIS = 1;
166 
167 		return Label;
168 	}
169 );
170
